page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION FLECKNEY
page.content: 5GENERAL DESCRIPTION, FLECKNEY This is an area of gently undulating countryside with no special features. The blockcontains the small village of Saddington and Smeeton Westerby, the large village of Fleckney and part of the much larger village of Kibworth. The area is mainly agricultural although there is some industry in Fleckney and Kibworth. Fleckney has grown rapidly over the last few years with several new housing and one industrial estate being built. The farming is mainly mixed with the growing of cereal crops and the raising of livestock(cattle and sheep). The block also contains most of Saddington Reservoir, the largest sheet of water in Leicestershire which was built to feed the nearby canal.
